parse: Verb - Aorist Subjunctive Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: From ek and agorazo; to buy up, i.e. Ransom; figuratively, to rescue from loss.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
A primary preposition; under, i.e. of place, or with verbs; of place (underneath) or where (below) or time (when).
From a primary nemo; law, genitive case, specially, (including the volume); also of the Gospel), or figuratively.
In order that, so that. Probably from the same as the former part of heautou; in order that.

parse: Verb - Aorist Subjunctive Active - 1st Person Plural
str2: From apo and lambano; to receive; also to take aside.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
From a presumed compound of huios and a derivative of tithemi; the placing as a son, i.e. Adoption.
